epoch.description: Epoch time of the object creation

documentation.description: URI of the documentation of the object

basemessageurl.description: Reference to a base definition for this definition, either via a (relative) URL or a fragment identifier. The base definition is overridden by this definition. If not present, this definition does not override any base definition

dataschemaformat.description: The schema format applicable to the message payload, equivalent to the 'format' attribute of the schema registry

dataschema.description: The inline schema for the message payload, equivalent to the 'schema' attribute of the schema registry

dataschemauri.description: The URI of the schema for the message payload, equivalent to the 'schemauri' attribute of the schema registry

datacontenttype.description: The content type for the message payload

envelope.description: Message envelope format identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'envelope' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups. The predefined envelope format is 'CloudEvents/1.0'

envelopemetadata.description: CloudEvents attribute declarations, adding constraints to the CloudEvents envelope not yet covered by the CloudEvents spec https://github.com/cloudevents/spec/blob/main/cloudevents/spec.md

dataschema.description: CloudEvents dataschema https://github.com/cloudevents/spec/blob/main/cloudevents/spec.md#dataschema. The URI of the schema for the event payload. Absence indicates no known schema. This attribute corresponds to the 'dataschemauri' attribute in the message definition and MUST be the same as the 'dataschemauri' attribute of the definition if present.

mode.description: Whether CloudEvents 'binary' or 'structured' mode will be used

format.description: The media type format used to serialize the CloudEvent in the case of mode=structured

protocol.description: Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

type.description: AMQP properties.message-id type constraint. The type values refer to the AMQP type model` and the defined message-id types

protocol.description: Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups
Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups
Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

key.description: The Apache Kafka key as a UTF-8 uri template. Mutually exclusive with 'key_base64'

key_base64.description: Binary Apache Kafka key as a base64 encoded string. Mutually exclusive with 'key'

protocol.description: Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

path.description: The HTTP path as a uri template

protocol.description: Protocol identifier. This attribute MUST be the same as the 'protocol' attribute of the definition group, but is not automatically inherited because definitions may be cross-referenced across groups

epoch.description: Epoch time of the object creation

documentation.description: URI of the documentation of the object

envelope.description: Envelope format identifier that defines the common metadata information for the message. All definitions in this group share this envelope format. Mixed-envelope-format groups are not permitted. The predefined envelope format is CloudEvents/1.0

protocol.description: Protocol identifier that defines the transport message protocol. All definitions in this group share this protocol type. Mixed-protocol groups are not permitted. Predefined protocol formats are 'AMQP/1.0', 'MQTT/3.1.1', 'MQTT/5.0', 'KAFKA', 'HTTP', and 'NATS'

epoch.description: Epoch time of the object creation

documentation.description: URI of the documentation of the object

usage.description: Client's expected usage of this endpoint

deprecated.description: Indicates whether the endpoint is deprecated

messagegroups.description: The message groups that are supported by this endpoint

envelope.description: Envelope metadata format identifier. If set, all definitions MUST use this format value

protocol.description: Endpoint protocol identifier. If set, all definitions MUST use this protocol value

endpoints.description: The network addresses that are for communication with the endpoint. The endpoints are ordered by preference, with the first endpoint being the preferred endpoint. Some protocol implementations might not support multiple endpoints, in which case all but the first endpoint might be ignored. Whether the URI just identifies a network host or links directly to a resource managed by the network host is protocol specific

authorization.description: Authorization options. These are hints for the adapter for interacting with the authorization endpoint. This is not a credentials configuration

type.description: The authentication/authorization type. OAuth2, Plain, APIKey, and X509Cert are well-defined

resourceuri.description: The resource uri for which authorization shall be granted (if applicable)

authorityuri.description: The authority uri where authorization shall be requested (if applicable)

granttypes.description: The grant types that can be requested (if applicable)

deployed.description: If `true`, the endpoint metadata represents a public, live endpoint that is available for communication and a strict validator MAY test the liveness of the endpoint

node.description: The AMQP node name. Commonly the name of a queue or a topic. Corresponds to the 'address' in source or target of the attach frame.

durable.description: The AMQP durable flag. Whether the node is durable or transient

link-properties.description: An optional map of AMQP link properties to use with the endpoint

connection-properties.description: An optional map of AMQP connection properties to use with the endpoint

distribution-mode.description: The AMQP distribution mode for receivers. Can be 'move' or 'copy'.  A value of 'move' indicates an exclusive lock on the message. A value of 'copy' indicates a non-exclusive lock on the message

connection-capabilities.description: The AMQP capabilities to use with the endpoint

node-capabilities.description: The AMQP node capabilities to use with the endpoint

protocol.description: Endpoint protocol identifier. If set, all definitions MUST use this protocol value

endpoints.description: The network addresses that are for communication with the endpoint. The endpoints are ordered by preference, with the first endpoint being the preferred endpoint. Some protocol implementations might not support multiple endpoints, in which case all but the first endpoint might be ignored. Whether the URI just identifies a network host or links directly to a resource managed by the network host is protocol specific

uri.description: MQTT URI (mqtt, mqtts, or ws scheme)

authorization.description: Authorization options. These are hints for the adapter for interacting with the authorization endpoint. This is not a credentials configuration

type.description: The authentication/authorization type. OAuth2, Plain, APIKey, and X509Cert are well-defined

resourceurl.description: The resource uri for which authorization shall be granted (if applicable)

authorityuri.description: The authority uri where authorization shall be requested (if applicable)

granttypes.description: The grant types that can be requested (if applicable)

deployed.description: If `true`, the endpoint metadata represents a public, live endpoint that is available for communication and a strict validator MAY test the liveness of the endpoint

topic.description: The MQTT topic path that is used for communication with the endpoint unless overridden by the message

qos.description: The MQTT QoS level. May be 0, 1, or 2

retain.description: The MQTT retain flag to use for publishers on ths endpoint

cleansession.description: The MQTT clean session flag to use for publishers on this endpoint

willtopic.description: The MQTT will topic to configure for publishers on this endpoint

willmessage.description: The MQTT will message definition to configure for publishers on this endpoint. This MUST be a reference to a message definition

acks.description: The Apache Kafka acks setting to use. If no acks setting is specified, the default is -1

partition.description: The Apache Kafka partition number to use when writing to or receiving from Apache Kafka

consumergroup.description: The Apache Kafka consumer group name to use for consumers
